title: Installation issue: gettext (needed for python) fails on aarch64
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install gettext
==> Installing gettext-0.21-lq3vnxyljeeohvzi5nrm6abdlg3j5edx
==> No binary for gettext-0.21-lq3vnxyljeeohvzi5nrm6abdlg3j5edx found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /snx11273/home/br-apoenaru/spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/d2/d20fcbb537e02dcf1383197ba05bd0734ef7bf5db06bdb241eb69b7d16b73192.tar.xz
==> No patches needed for gettext
==> gettext: Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> Error: RuntimeError: Failed to find suitable substitutes for config.sub, config.guess

/snx11273/home/br-apoenaru/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/autotools.py:172, in _do_patch_config_files:
        169
        170        # Check that we found everything we needed
        171        if to_be_found:
  >>    172            msg = 'Failed to find suitable substitutes for {0}'
        173            raise RuntimeError(msg.format(', '.join(to_be_found)))
        174
        175        # Copy the good files over the bad ones
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.16.1
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** cray-rhel8-aarch64
* **Concretizer:** original

### Additional information

* [spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6448549/spack-build-env.txt)
* [spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6448550/spack-build-out.txt)

The error message is the same as in  #21256, but this doesn't seem to be a permissions issue:

```console
$ find . -type f -name config.guess -exec ls -l {} +
-rwxrwxr-x   ./spack-src/build-aux/config.guess
-rwxrwxr-x   ./spack-src/gettext-tools/examples/hello-c++-kde/admin/config.guess
-rwxrwxr-x   ./spack-src/libtextstyle/build-aux/config.guess

$ find . -type f -name config.sub -exec ls -l {} +
-rwxrwxr-x   ./spack-src/build-aux/config.sub
-rwxrwxr-x   ./spack-src/gettext-tools/examples/hello-c++-kde/admin/config.sub
-rwxrwxr-x   ./spack-src/libtextstyle/build-aux/config.sub
```

Mentioning maintainers for Python: @adamjstewart  @skosukhin
